title: Calculate AZTI’s Marine Biotic Index
text: R package implementing AZTI’s Marine Biotic Index.

title: Calculate AZTI’s Marine Biotic Index
text: package allows user calculate AMBI index multivariate M-AMBI count data benthic species. original software AZTI can downloaded https://ambi.azti.es/. addition, package includes functions calculate different versions Danish Quality Index (DKI) (Danish: Dansk Kvalitetsindeks), derived benthic index based AMBI. AMBI() - calculates AMBI index. MAMBI() - calculates multivariate M-AMBI index. Hdash() - calculates H’, Shannon diversity index. DKI2() - calculates salinity-normalised Danish quality index DKI (v2). DKI() - calculates Danish quality index DKI.

title: Calculate AZTI’s Marine Biotic Index
text: Input AMBI() function dataframe species counts optional grouping variables, e.g. station replicate IDs. function matches species names input data names AMBI species list, order categorise observed species according AMBI method. tool calculates AMBI index resulting distribution individuals groups. AMBI species list gives groups (, II, III, IV, V) species classified, described Borja et al (2000): Group Species sensitive organic enrichment present unpolluted conditions (initial state). include specialist carnivores deposit- feeding tubicolous polychaetes. Group II Species indifferent enrichment, always present low densities non-significant variations time (initial state, slight unbalance). include suspension feeders, less selective carnivores scavengers. Group III Species tolerant excess organic matter enrichment. species may occur normal conditions, populations stimulated organic richment (slight unbalance situations). surface deposit-feeding species, tubicolous spionids. Group IV Second-order opportunistic species (slight pronounced unbalanced situations). Mainly small sized polychaetes: subsurface deposit-feeders, cirratulids. Group V First-order opportunistic species (pronounced unbalanced situations). deposit- feeders, proliferate reduced sediments. list species groups updated several times authors AMBI software. version list used 8th October 2024.

title: Calculate AZTI’s Marine Biotic Index
text: can install development version ambiR GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("niva-denmark/ambiR")

title: Calculate AZTI’s Marine Biotic Index
text: basic example using small dataset. Another example using supplied test_data.
code: library(ambiR)  df <- data.frame(station = c("1","1","2","2","2"), species = c("Acidostoma neglectum",              "Acrocirrus validus",              "Acteocina bullata",              "Austrohelice crassa",              "Capitella nonatoi"),              count = c(2, 4, 5, 3, 7))  AMBI(df, by = c("station")) #> Warning: station 1: The percentage of individuals not assigned to a group is higher than #> 20% [33.3%]. #> Warning: station 1: The (not null) number of species is less than 3 [2]. #> Warning: station 1: The (not null) number of individuals is less than 6 [4]. #> $AMBI #> # A tibble: 2 × 11 #>   station  AMBI     H     S   fNA     N     I    II   III    IV     V #>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 1         4.5 0.918     2 0.333     6 0         0     0     1 0     #> 2 2         4   1.51      3 0        15 0.333     0     0     0 0.667 #>  #> $matched #>   station              species count group RA #> 1       1 Acidostoma neglectum     2     0  0 #> 2       1   Acrocirrus validus     4     4  0 #> 3       2    Acteocina bullata     5     1  0 #> 4       2  Austrohelice crassa     3     5  0 #> 5       2    Capitella nonatoi     7     5  0 #>  #> $warnings #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   station warning                                                                #>   <chr>   <chr>                                                                  #> 1 1       The percentage of individuals not assigned to a group is higher than … #> 2 1       The (not null) number of species is less than 3 [2].                   #> 3 1       The (not null) number of individuals is less than 6 [4]. library(ambiR)  ## calling AMBI using the test data set AMBI(test_data, by=c("station"), var_rep = "replicate") #> $AMBI #> # A tibble: 3 × 11 #>   station  AMBI     H     S   fNA     N     I    II   III     IV      V #>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1       1  1.48  1.80     6     0    16 0.125 0.75  0.125 0      0      #> 2       2  1.89  3.54    22     0    80 0.4   0.138 0.3   0.15   0.0125 #> 3       3  4.12  2.50     9     0    24 0     0.125 0.292 0.0833 0.5    #>  #> $matched #> # A tibble: 53 × 6 #>    station replicate species             count group    RA #>      <dbl> <chr>     <chr>               <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1       1 a         Cumopsis fagei          2     2     0 #>  2       1 a         Diogenes pugilator      2     2     0 #>  3       1 a         Paradoneis armata       1     3     0 #>  4       1 b         Bathyporeia elegans     1     1     0 #>  5       1 b         Diogenes pugilator      5     2     0 #>  6       1 b         Dispio uncinata         1     3     0 #>  7       1 c         Astarte sp.             1     1     0 #>  8       1 c         Diogenes pugilator      3     2     0 #>  9       2 a         Cumopsis fagei          1     2     0 #> 10       2 a         Glycera tridactyla      2     2     0 #> # ℹ 43 more rows #>  #> $warnings #> NULL

title: Calculates AMBI, the AZTI Marine Biotic Index — AMBI
text: Borja, ., Franco, J., Pérez, V. (2000) marine biotic index establish ecological quality soft bottom benthos within European estuarine coastal environments. Marine Pollution Bulletin 40(12): 1100-1114. https://doi.org/10.1016/S0025-326X(00)00061-8

title: Calculates AMBI, the AZTI Marine Biotic Index — AMBI
text: df dataframe species observations vector column names found df calculations grouped e.g. c("station","date") var_rep optional column name df contains name column identifying replicates. replicates used, AMBI index calculated replicate average calculated combination variables. Shannon diversity index H calculated done species counts collected within groups without consideration replicates. var_species name column df containing species names var_count name column df containing count/density/abundance df_species optional dataframe user-specified species groups. default, function matches species df official species list AZTI. dataframe user-defined list species provided , used instead. var_group_AMBI optional name column df_species containing groups AMBI index calculations. specified integer values 1 7. values ignored. df_species specified var_group_AMBI ignored.

title: Calculates AMBI, the AZTI Marine Biotic Index — AMBI
text: list three dataframes: AMBI : results AMBI index calculations. unique combination variables, following values calculated: AMBI : AMBI index value N : number individuals S : number species H : Shannon diversity index fNA : fraction individuals assigned, , matched species AZTI species Group 0. Note different number rows match found. excluded totals. match : original dataframe columns added species list. user-specified list provided df_species, columns included. default AZTI species list following additional columns included: group : showing species group RA : indicating species reallocatable according AZTI list. , re-assigned different species group. species/taxa df match df_species NA columns. warnings : dataframe showing warnings combination variables warning percentage individuals assigned group higher 20% (null) number species less 3 (null) number individuals less 6

title: Calculates AMBI, the AZTI Marine Biotic Index — AMBI
text: Species can matched one five groups, distribution individuals groups reflecting different levels stress ecosystem. Group . Species sensitive organic enrichment present unpolluted conditions (initial state). include specialist carnivores deposit- feeding tubicolous polychaetes. Group II. Species indifferent enrichment, always present low densities non-significant variations time (initial state, slight unbalance). include suspension feeders, less selective carnivores scavengers. Group III. Species tolerant excess organic matter enrichment. species may occur normal conditions, populations stimulated organic enrichment (slight unbalance situations). surface deposit-feeding species, tubicolous spionids. Group IV. Second-order opportunistic species (slight pronounced unbalanced situations). Mainly small sized polychaetes: subsurface deposit-feeders, cirratulids. Group V. First-order opportunistic species (pronounced unbalanced situations). deposit- feeders, proliferate reduced sediments. distribution ecological groups, according sensitivity pollution stress, provides BI eight levels, 0 7 Biotic Coefficient = (0.0 * GI + l.5 * GII + 3.0 * GIII + 4.5 * GIV + 6.0 * GV) : Gn := fraction individuals Group n [, II, III, IV, V] certain circumstances, AMBI index used: percentage individuals assigned group higher 20% (null) number species less 3 (null) number individuals less 6 cases function still perform calculations also return warning:

title: Returns species list for AMBI calculations — AMBI_species
text: data frame 11,952 rows* 3 columns: species Species name genus (spp.) group Species group AMBI index calculation RA reallocatable *latest version 8th October 2024

title: Returns species list for AMBI calculations — AMBI_species
text: species groups, described Borja et al (2000): Group  Species sensitive organic enrichment present unpolluted conditions (initial state). include specialist carnivores deposit- feeding tubicolous polychaetes. Group II  Species indifferent enrichment, always present low densities non-significant variations time (initial state, slight unbalance). include suspension feeders, less selective carnivores scavengers. Group III  Species tolerant excess organic matter enrichment. species may occur normal conditions, populations stimulated organic richment (slight unbalance situations). surface deposit-feeding species, tubicolous spionids. Group IV  Second-order opportunistic species (slight pronounced unbalanced situations). Mainly small sized polychaetes: subsurface deposit-feeders, cirratulids. Group V  First-order opportunistic species (pronounced unbalanced situations). deposit- feeders, proliferate reduced sediments.

title: Calculates DKI (v1) — DKI
text: Calculates Danish quality index DKI (v1) DKI based AMBI can calculated first calculating AMBI, AZTI Marine Biotic Index, H', Shannon diversity index. indices included output function AMBI(). function uses estimated maximum value H' H_max Danish waters reference value normalise DKI. value specified argument, function uses default value (5.0)

title: Calculates DKI (v1) — DKI
code: DKI(AMBI, H, N, S, H_max = 5)

title: Calculates DKI (v1) — DKI
text: Danish quality index described : Carstensen, J., Krause-Jensen, D., Josefson, . (2014) Development testing tools intercalibration phytoplankton, macrovegetation benthic fauna Danish coastal areas. Scientific Report DCE – Danish Centre Environment Energy . 93. https://dce2.au.dk/pub/SR93.pdf Reference default value H_max = 5: "However, present exercise, Danish method used Hmax (∼5) kind reference" Borja, ., Josefson, .B., Miles, ., Muxika, ., Olsgaard, F., Phillips, G., Rodríguez, J.G. & Rygg, B. 2007: approach intercalibration benthic ecological status assessment North Atlantic ecoregion, according European Water Framework Directive. - Marine Pollution Bulletin 55:42-52. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.marpolbul.2006.08.018

title: Calculates DKI (v1) — DKI
text: AMBI AMBI, AZTI Marine Biotic Index, calculated using AMBI() H H', Shannon diversity index, calculated using Hdash() N number individuals - generated AMBI() Hdash() S number species - generated AMBI() Hdash() H_max maximum H' used normalise AMBI, default 5

title: Calculates DKI (v1) — DKI
text: DKI index value

title: Calculates DKI (v1) — DKI
text: AMBI() Hdash() functions take dataframe observations argument. DKI functions, DKI2() DKI(), take dataframe argument. Instead take values input parameters, either single values vectors. calculate DKI dataframe AMBI values, called e.g. within dplyr::mutate() function call. See examples .

title: Calculates DKI (v1) — DKI
code: # Simple example  DKI(AMBI = 1.61, H = 2.36, N = 25, S = 6) #> [1] 0.55683   # ------ Example workflow for calculating DKI from species counts ----  # calculate AMBI index dfAMBI <- AMBI(test_data, by = c("station"), var_rep="replicate")[["AMBI"]]  # show AMBI results dfAMBI #> # A tibble: 3 × 11 #>   station  AMBI     H     S   fNA     N     I    II   III     IV      V #>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1       1  1.48  1.80     6     0    16 0.125 0.75  0.125 0      0      #> 2       2  1.89  3.54    22     0    80 0.4   0.138 0.3   0.15   0.0125 #> 3       3  4.12  2.50     9     0    24 0     0.125 0.292 0.0833 0.5     # calculate DKI from AMBI results dplyr::mutate(dfAMBI, DKI = DKI(AMBI, H, N, S)) #> # A tibble: 3 × 12 #>   station  AMBI     H     S   fNA     N     I    II   III     IV      V   DKI #>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> #> 1       1  1.48  1.80     6     0    16 0.125 0.75  0.125 0      0      0.509 #> 2       2  1.89  3.54    22     0    80 0.4   0.138 0.3   0.15   0.0125 0.698 #> 3       3  4.12  2.50     9     0    24 0     0.125 0.292 0.0833 0.5    0.421

title: Calculates DKI (v2) — DKI2
text: function calculates salinity-normalised version Danish quality index (DKI) DKI based AMBI can calculated first calculating AMBI, AZTI Marine Biotic Index, H', Shannon diversity index. indices included output function AMBI(). function uses linear relationships salinity limits AMBI Hdash normalise index. Since index normalised salinity, function also requires measured estimated salinity psal argument.

title: Calculates DKI (v2) — DKI2
code: DKI2(AMBI, H, N, psal)

title: Calculates DKI (v2) — DKI2
text: Danish quality index described Carstensen, J., Krause-Jensen, D., Josefson, . (2014) Development testing tools intercalibration phytoplankton, macrovegetation benthic fauna Danish coastal areas. Scientific Report DCE – Danish Centre Environment Energy . 93. https://dce2.au.dk/pub/SR93.pdf

title: Calculates DKI (v2) — DKI2
text: AMBI AMBI, AZTI Marine Biotic Index, calculated using AMBI() H H', Shannon diversity index, calculated using Hdash() N number individuals - generated AMBI() Hdash() psal salinity

title: Calculates DKI (v2) — DKI2
text: DKI index value

title: Calculates DKI (v2) — DKI2
text: AMBI() Hdash() functions take dataframe observations argument. DKI functions, DKI2() DKI(), take dataframe argument. Instead take values input parameters, either single values vectors. calculate DKI dataframe AMBI values, called e.g. within dplyr::mutate() function call. See examples .

title: Calculates DKI (v2) — DKI2
code: # Simple example  DKI2(AMBI = 1.61, H = 2.36, N = 25, psal = 21.4) #> [1] 0.7043697   # ------ Example workflow for calculating DKI (v2) from species counts ----  # calculate AMBI index dfAMBI <- AMBI(test_data, by = c("station"), var_rep = "replicate")[["AMBI"]]  # show AMBI results dfAMBI #> # A tibble: 3 × 11 #>   station  AMBI     H     S   fNA     N     I    II   III     IV      V #>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1       1  1.48  1.80     6     0    16 0.125 0.75  0.125 0      0      #> 2       2  1.89  3.54    22     0    80 0.4   0.138 0.3   0.15   0.0125 #> 3       3  4.12  2.50     9     0    24 0     0.125 0.292 0.0833 0.5     # add salinity values - these are realistic but invented values dfAMBI <- dplyr::mutate(dfAMBI, psal=ifelse(station == 1, 21.3, 26.5))  # calculate DKI from AMBI results dfAMBI <- dplyr::mutate(dfAMBI, DKI=DKI2(AMBI, H, N, psal))

what: Maximum H' as a linear function of salinity — H_sal
title: Maximum H' as a linear function of salinity — H_sal
text: AMBI_sal H_sal called AMBI_min H_max DKI documentation renamed reflect fact functions salinity min/max  values data used function

title: Maximum H' as a linear function of salinity — H_sal
code: H_sal(psal, intercept = 2.117, slope = 0.086)

title: Maximum H' as a linear function of salinity — H_sal
text: https://dce2.au.dk/pub/SR93.pdf

title: Maximum H' as a linear function of salinity — H_sal
text: psal numeric salinity intercept numeric, default 2.117 slope numeric default 0.086

title: Maximum H' as a linear function of salinity — H_sal
text: numeric value H_max

title: Maximum H' as a linear function of salinity — H_sal

what: Calculates H' the Shannon diversity index — Hdash
title: Calculates H' the Shannon diversity index — Hdash
text: Matches list species counts AMBI species list calculates  H' Shannon diversity index

title: Calculates H' the Shannon diversity index — Hdash
code: Hdash(   df,   by = NULL,   var_species = "species",   var_count = "count",   check_species = TRUE,   df_species = NULL )

title: Calculates H' the Shannon diversity index — Hdash
text: df dataframe species observations vector column names found df calculations grouped e.g. c("station","date") var_species name column df containing species names var_count name column df containing count/density/abundance check_species boolean, default = TRUE. TRUE, species found species list included H' index. default, AZTI species list used. df_species optional dataframe user-specified species list.

title: Calculates H' the Shannon diversity index — Hdash
text: list two dataframes: H : results AMBI index calculations. unique combination byvariables following values calculated: H : Shannon Diversity Index, H' S : number species N : number individuals match : original dataframe columns added species list. user-specified list provided df_species, columns included. user-specified species list contains single column species names, new column match created, value 1 indicating match NA value match found. default AZTI species list following additional columns included: group : showing AMBI species group RA : indicating species reallocatable according AZTI list. , re-assigned different species group.

title: Calculates H' the Shannon diversity index — Hdash
text: function called check_species = TRUE species succesfully matched specifed species list included calculations. default. function called check_species = FALSEthen rows counted.

title: Calculates H' the Shannon diversity index — Hdash
code: Hdash(test_data, by=c("station")) #> $H #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   station     H     N     S #>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int> #> 1       1  1.80    16     6 #> 2       2  3.54    80    22 #> 3       3  2.50    24     9 #>  #> $matched #> # A tibble: 53 × 6 #>    station replicate species             count group    RA #>      <dbl> <chr>     <chr>               <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1       1 a         Cumopsis fagei          2     2     0 #>  2       1 a         Diogenes pugilator      2     2     0 #>  3       1 a         Paradoneis armata       1     3     0 #>  4       1 b         Bathyporeia elegans     1     1     0 #>  5       1 b         Diogenes pugilator      5     2     0 #>  6       1 b         Dispio uncinata         1     3     0 #>  7       1 c         Astarte sp.             1     1     0 #>  8       1 c         Diogenes pugilator      3     2     0 #>  9       2 a         Cumopsis fagei          1     2     0 #> 10       2 a         Glycera tridactyla      2     2     0 #> # ℹ 43 more rows #>

what: Calculates M-AMBI, the multivariate AZTI Marine Biotic Index — MAMBI
title: Calculates M-AMBI, the multivariate AZTI Marine Biotic Index — MAMBI
text: Calculate M-AMBI multivariate AMBI index, based three separate species diversity metrics: AMBI index AMBI. Shannon Wiener diversity index H' Species richness S.

title: Calculates M-AMBI, the multivariate AZTI Marine Biotic Index — MAMBI
code: MAMBI(   df,   by = NULL,   var_H = "H",   var_S = "S",   var_AMBI = "AMBI",   limits_AMBI = c(bad = 6, high = 0),   limits_H = c(bad = 0, high = NA),   limits_S = c(bad = 0, high = NA),   bounds = c(PB = 0.2, MP = 0.39, GM = 0.53, HG = 0.77) )

title: Calculates M-AMBI, the multivariate AZTI Marine Biotic Index — MAMBI
text: "AMBI, richness diversity, combined use, development, factor analysis together discriminant analysis, presented objective tool (named M-AMBI) assessing ecological quality status" (Muxika et al. 2007) Borja, ., Franco, J., Pérez, V. (2000) marine biotic index establish ecological quality soft bottom benthos within European estuarine coastal environments. Marine Pollution Bulletin 40(12): 1100-1114. https://doi.org/10.1016/S0025-326X(00)00061-8 Muxika, ., Borja, ., Bald, J. (2007) Using historical data, expert judgement multivariate analysis assessing reference conditions benthic ecological status, according European Water Framework Directive. Marine Pollution Bulletin, 55: 16-29. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.marpolbul.2006.05.025

title: Calculates M-AMBI, the multivariate AZTI Marine Biotic Index — MAMBI
